result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey D Joe in court, in custody.  Attorney Zaki Zehawi in court for Jeffrey D Joe.  Attorney Paul Humphrey and  Ben Wagner for Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Discovery is being exchanged and parties working on settlement. Notice in hand given for next court date.
Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list
and returned.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 (per case). $1,000 previously posted. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward Marsha P. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

12:06 PM Defendant Jeffrey D Joe in court.  Attorney Zaki Zehawi in court for Jeffrey D Joe.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests no contact to be modified. Argument by Defn. State takes no position. CT only addressessing this case today. CT amends "Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Marsha P." TO "Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward Marsha P." ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 14

State moves to dismiss ct 1. CT so grants. Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Atty Zaki Zehawi

Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey D Joe in court, in custody.  Attorney Frank Remington for Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. DE's motion to amend bond. DE requesting signature bond. Court reviews chronology of case. State objecting to modification of bond. Statement by MJP. MJP requesting no contact bond condition be removed. State not requesting no contact be removed. Court denies motion to amend bond.

Defendant Jeffrey D Joe in court, in custody.  Attorney Frank Remington for Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. SPD is working on an appointment. DE requests to proceed pro se. Court has colloquy with DE in regards to his right to an attorney. Court accepts waiver to an attorney. Court schedules preliminary hearing. DE signed up for text message reminders.
